intro: Camellia latipetiolata, commonly known as the broad-petioled camellia, is a species of flowering plant in the Theaceae family. It is native to China and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has large, leathery leaves with broad petioles, which give it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Camellia latipetiolata prefers acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for shaded garden areas.
